subject: AI
title: Parallel Tool Calls
description: Call multiple tools at once to speed up the agent.

hook.text: The agent needs weather in Tokyo, a flight search, and hotel availability. It calls them one at a time: 3 seconds each, 9 seconds total. It could have called all three at once.

buildup.text: Modern LLM APIs support parallel tool calls ‚Äî the model can request multiple tool invocations in a single response. Your code executes them concurrently and returns all results.

discovery.text: Enable parallel tool calling when tools are independent: weather, flights, and hotels don't depend on each other. The model outputs all three call requests in one turn.

twist.text: Not all tools can run in parallel. If tool B needs tool A's output (search for flights ‚Üí then book the cheapest), the model must call them sequentially. The model usually gets dependency ordering right, but verify.

climax.text: Parallel tool calls cut agent latency dramatically for independent tasks. Enable it by default and let the model decide when to parallelize.

punchline.text: Independent tools? Call them at the same time. Dependent tools? One at a time. Let the model figure out which is which.

quiz.question: When should tool calls be parallelized?
options: When the tools are independent and don't need each other's output
Only when there are exactly 2 tools
